text.0: the guerdon is bestowed the mighty takes his seat and everwatchful guards from fiend and evil sprite.
text.1: goldhued he makes the cloud his diadem the milk his carpet in both worlds and prayer his robe of state.
text.2: strong bellowing he goes like one who slays the folk he lets this hue of asuras flow off from him.
text.3: throws off his covering seeks his fathers meetingplace and thus makes for himself the bright robe he assumes.
text.4: onward he flows from both the hands pressed out with stones excited by the prayer the water makes him wild.
text.5: he frolics and draws near completes his work with song and bathes in streams to satisfy the worshipper.
text.6: they pour out meath around the master of the house celestial strengthener of the mountain that gives might.
text.7: in whom through his great powers oblationeating cows in their uplifted udder mix their choicest milk.
text.8: they the ten sisters on the lap of aditi have sent him forward like a car from both the arms.
text.9: he wanders and comes near the cows mysterious place even the place which his inventions have produced.
text.10: like as a falcon to his home so speeds the god to his own golden wiselytashioned place to rest.
text.11: with song they urge the darling to the sacred grass the holy one goes like a courser to the gods.
text.12: from far away from heaven the redhued noted sage steer of the triple height hath sung unto the kine.
text.13: with thousand guidings he leading this way and that shines as a singer splendidly through many a morn.
text.14: his covering assumes a radiant hue whereer he comes into the fight he drives the foe afar.
text.15: the winner of the floods with food he seeks the host of heaven he comes to praises glorified with milk.
text.16: like a bull roaming round the herds he bellows he hath assumed the brilliancy of sūrya.
text.17: down to the earth hath looked the heavenly falcon soma with wisdom views all living creatures.
